intro: Hibbertia pallidiflora, commonly known as the pale-flowered hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows in heathland and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Hibbertia pallidiflora has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are adapted for animal dispersal. It is a hardy species that thrives in full sun and is often found in coastal regions.
